newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Cricket-Tasmania, South Australia struggle in Shield.
newsitem.headline: Cricket-Tasmania, South Australia struggle in Shield.

text.p: Former Australia batsman Ricky Ponting scored a half century on Friday to pull Tasmania out of trouble on the first day of their Sheffield Shield match against Queensland at Bellerive Oval.
Ponting was 56 not out as Tasmania reached 99 for three at lunch. Tasmania captain David Boon was 11 not out.

Queensland's pace bowlers tore through Tasmania's top order early in the first session for the home side to be struggling at 31 for three. Michael Kasprowicz removed opener Jamie Cox and number three Michael DiVenuto while Adam Dale accounted for opener Dene Hills.
Boon had earlier won the toss and chose to bat.
In Adelaide, last-placed South Australia were in deep trouble at 112 for five at lunch on the first day of their match against Victoria.
Seam bowler Damien Fleming took three wickets for 35 and paceman David Saker two for 44.
South Australia captain Jamie Siddons was the last man out, caught by Laurie Harper at extra cover after playing a risky shot off Saker. Siddons put his side in after winning the toss.
Joe Scuderi was 12 not out at lunch with Tim Nielsen yet to score.
In Perth, New South Wales captain Greg Matthews won the toss and decided to bat on the first day of the match against Shield leaders Western Australia.
New South Wales, third on the Shield table, need to win the match outright to have any chance of reaching the final later this month.
New South Wales - Michael Slater, Shane Lee, Corey Richards, Rodney Davison, Greg Matthews (captain), Kevin Roberts, Brad McNamara, Phil Emery, Anthony Stuart, Phil Alley, David Freedman.
Western Australia: Michael Hussey, Ryan Campbell, Murray Goodwin, Damien Martyn, Tom Moody (captain), Brad Hogg, Adam Gilchrist, Brendon Julian, Jo Angel, Matthew Garnaut, Bret Mulder.
